body_html:
Update
The timeout value is passed through, but no effect :(, still raise same exception.

Then I thought maybe too many variables for only 2 ps, I adjusted the cluster to 1 worker vs 4 ps, something new is happened.
The worker 0 still raise the same exception, and 2 of the PS servers raise: 'unit.device' Must be non NULL in tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/graph_mgr.cc:55.
Not sure if they are related.

body:
**Update**
The timeout value is passed through, but no effect :(, still raise same exception.  

Then I thought maybe too many variables for only 2 ps, I adjusted the cluster to 1 worker vs 4 ps, something new is happened. 
The worker 0 still raise the same exception, and 2 of the PS servers raise: **'unit.device' Must be non NULL** in tensorflow/core/distributed_runtime/graph_mgr.cc:55. 
Not sure if they are related.
